---
title: 'API Reference'
excerpt: 'Slekup API is a RESTful API based on HTTPS requests and JSON responses. It allows you to access your data in Slekup and create your own customized applications.'
position: 4
---

### Base URL

```plaintext
https://api.slekup.com/api
```

# API Versioning

<Alert
  type="warning"
  text="When versions become outdated, they will return 400 Bad Request."
/>

Slekup API is currently on version 1 We will be adding more features in the future.

## API Versions

<APIVersions />

When using the API, you must specify the version of the API you want to use in the URL path. For example, if you want to use version 1 of the API, you would use the following URL:

```plaintext
https://api.slekup.com/api/v1
```

# Error Messages

<Alert type="error" text="This section is not complete." />

When an error occurs, the API will return an error message in JSON format.

```json
{
  "code": "status code",
  "message": "error message"
}
```

# Status Codes

<Alert
  type="info"
  text="You will typically not receive most of these status codes. Status codes 200, 400, 401, 403, 404, and 500 are the most common."
/>

<StatusCodes />

# Authentication

<Alert type="error" text="This section is not complete." />

Authentication with Slekup API can be doen in two ways:

1. Using an application token (recommended)
2. using a user's session token

For all authentication types, authentication is performaned with the `Authorization` HTTP header in the format `Authorization: TOKEN_TYPE TOKEN`.

**Example Bot Token Authorization Header**

```yaml
Authorization: Bot TOKEN
```

**Example User Token Authorization Header**

```yaml
Authorization: Bearer TOKEN
```

# HTTP API

<Alert type="error" text="This section is not complete." />

## Rate Limiting

The HTTP API is rate limited to 5 requests per second per IP address. If you exceed this limit, you will receive a `429 Too Many Requests` response. See more about rate limiting <Link href='/dev/docs/introduction/rate-limits'>Here</Link>.

# Image Formatting

<Alert type="error" text="This section is not complete." />

**Image Base URL**

```plaintext
https://api.slekup.com/static
```

...

## Image Formats

| Format | Extension |
| ------ | --------- |
| JPEG   | jpg       |
| PNG    | png       |
| GIF    | gif       |
| WEBP   | webp      |

...

## Image Data

Image data is a <a target="_blank" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_URI_scheme">Data URI scheme</a>e that supports JPG, GIF, and PNG formats. An example Data URI format is:

```plaintext
data:image/jpeg;base64,BASE64_ENCODED_JPEG_IMAGE_DATA
```

Ensure you use the proper content type (`image/jpeg`, `image/png`, `image/gif`) that matches the image data being provided.
